summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection employs about 45,000 law enforcement personnel. Its duties include stopping the unlawful movement of people and drugs across U.S. borders. CBP has not been able to hire and retain its required number of Border Patrol agents or meet its goals for other law enforcement jobs. This testimony addresses its recruitment, hiring, and retention efforts, including our earlier recommendation to gather...
title: U.S. Customs and Border Protection: Progress and Challenges in Recruiting, Hiring, and Retaining Law Enforcement Personnel
